measure.name: condenser_fouling
measure.description: Condenser fouling occurs when litter, dirt, or dust accumulates on or between the fins of a condenser of an air conditioner located in the outdoor environment. The blockage reduces the airflow across the condenser and increases the condensing temperature in the refrigerant circuit. The elevated temperature increases the pressure difference across the compressor and reduces the equipment efficiency. This measure simulates condenser fouling by modifying the Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed object in EnergyPlus assigned to the heating and cooling system. The fault intensity (F) for this fault is defined as the ratio of reduction in condenser coil airflow at full load.
measure.modeler_description: Thirty two user inputs (DX coil where the fault occurs / Percentage reduction of condenser airflow / rated cooling capacity / rated sensible heat ratio / rated volumetric flow rate / minimum-maximum evaporator air inlet wet-bulb temperature / minimum-maximum condenser air inlet dry-bulb temperature / minimum/maximum rated COP / percentage change of UA with increase of fault level / time required for fault to reach full level / fault starting month / fault starting date / fault starting time / fault ending month / fault ending date / fault ending time) can be defined or remained with default values. Based on user inputs, the cooling capacity (Q Ì‡_cool) and EIR in the DX cooling coil model is recalculated to reflect the faulted operation. The time required for the fault to reach the full level is only required when user wants to model dynamic fault evolution. If dynamic fault evolution is not necessary for the user, it can be defined as zero and the fault intensity will be imposed as a step function with user defined value. However, by defining the time required for the fault to reach the full level, fault starting month/date/time and fault ending month/date/time, the adjustment factor AF is calculated at each time step starting from the starting month/date/time to gradually impose fault intensity based on the user specified time frame. AF is calculated as follows, AF_current = AF_previous + dt/tau where AF_current is the adjustment factor calculated based on the previously calculated adjustment factor (AF_previous), simulation timestep (dt) and the time required for the fault to reach the full level (tau).

argument.name: coil_choice
argument.display_name: Enter the name of the faulted Coil:Cooling:DX:SingleSpeed object. If you want to impose the fault on all coils, select * ALL Coil Selected *

argument.name: fault_lvl
argument.display_name: Percentage reduction of condenser airflow [-]

argument.name: q_rat
argument.display_name: Rated cooling capacity of the cooling coil for bypass factor model adjustment. If your system is autosized or you do not know what this is, please run the OS Measure Auto Size to Hard Size before this Measure. If your system is hard sized, leave this value at -1.0. (W)

argument.name: shr_rat
argument.display_name: Rated sensible heat ratio of the cooling coil for bypass factor model adjustment. If your system is autosized or you do not know what this is, please run the OS Measure Auto Size to Hard Size before this Measure. If your system is hard sized, leave this value at -1.0.

argument.name: vol_rat
argument.display_name: Rated air flow rate of the cooling coil for bypass factor model adjustment. If your system is autosized or you do not know what this is, please run the OS Measure Auto Size to Hard Size before this Measure. If your system is hard sized, leave this value at -1.0. (m3/s)

argument.name: min_fl
argument.display_name: Maximum value of fault level [-]

argument.name: Q_CAa1
argument.display_name: Parameter a1 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: Q_CAa2
argument.display_name: Parameter a2 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: Q_CAa3
argument.display_name: Parameter a3 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: Q_CAa4
argument.display_name: Parameter a4 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: Q_CAa5
argument.display_name: Parameter a5 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: Q_CAa6
argument.display_name: Parameter a6 for the Q_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa1
argument.display_name: Parameter a1 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa2
argument.display_name: Parameter a2 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa3
argument.display_name: Parameter a3 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa4
argument.display_name: Parameter a4 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa5
argument.display_name: Parameter a5 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: EIR_CAa6
argument.display_name: Parameter a6 for the EIR_CA model

argument.name: min_wb_tmp_uc
argument.display_name: Minimum value of evaporator air inlet wet-bulb temperature [C]

argument.name: max_wb_tmp_uc
argument.display_name: Maximum value of evaporator air inlet wet-bulb temperature [C]

argument.name: min_cond_tmp_uc
argument.display_name: Minimum value of condenser air inlet temperature [C]

argument.name: max_cond_tmp_uc
argument.display_name: Maximum value of condenser air inlet temperature [C]

argument.name: min_cop_uc
argument.display_name: Minimum value of rated COP

argument.name: max_cop_uc
argument.display_name: Maximum value of rated COP

argument.name: bf_para
argument.display_name: Percentage change of UA with increase of fault level level (% of UA/% of fault level)

argument.name: time_constant
argument.display_name: Enter the time required for fault to reach full level [hr]

argument.name: start_month
argument.display_name: Enter the month (1-12) when the fault starts to occur

argument.name: start_date
argument.display_name: Enter the date (1-28/30/31) when the fault starts to occur

argument.name: start_time
argument.display_name: Enter the time of day (0-24) when the fault starts to occur

argument.name: end_month
argument.display_name: Enter the month (1-12) when the fault ends

argument.name: end_date
argument.display_name: Enter the date (1-28/30/31) when the fault ends

argument.name: end_time
argument.display_name: Enter the time of day (0-24) when the fault ends
